feed.title: NetAlertX Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v25.3.1 - ğŸ“š New Docs portal, OMADA plugin and more MQTT attributes
entry.content:
Release Highlights ğŸš€

This release introduces a new OMADA (OMDSDNOPENAPI) plugin, contributed by @xfilo, as well as a revamped docs portal with improved search and navigation for a better user experience.

ğŸ” The MQTT plugin now sends additional attributes to Home Assistantâ€™s device tracker object, enabling more detailed filtering of your devices.

To mitigate Docker Hub pull limits, container images will now also be available on the GitHub Container Registry (GHCR).

In other news, the Discord community has grown to nearly 100 members! ğŸ’™

Read on below for all the details included in this release!

| | | |--------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------|

ğŸ˜ï¸ Community

  • Almost 100 Discord members ğŸ¥³
  • @im-redactd created a OPNsense script to generate a dnsmasq compatible leases file for the DHCPLSS plugin ğŸ†•

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • New, easier to search docs site ğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • A new OMDSDNOPENAPI plugin by @xfilo ğŸ†•
  • Easier filtering and listing in Home Assistant as MQTT now sends more device attributes into the app #999 âœ¨
  • The NTFY plugin supports now token authentication âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • Removal of some unnecessary default values from device dropdowns âœ¨
  • More control over new device names to keep or remove . (dots) in names #1002 âœ¨

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • Fix spelling mistake in unifi plugin by @Peter-Maguire in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/996
  • New plugin: Omada SDN import using OpenAPI (OMDSDNOPENAPI) by @xfilo in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1005
  • OMDSDNOPENAPI - Run command change due to plugin folder rename by @xfilo in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1006
  • OMDSDNOPENAPI - Fixed example in README.md, improved logging and code logic by @xfilo in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1007
  • OMDSDNOPENAPI - Refactored data collection into a class, improved code clarity with comments by @xfilo in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1008

New Contributors

  • @Peter-Maguire made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/996
  • @xfilo made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1005

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v25.2.8...v25.3.1

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v25.4.1 - ğŸ”€ Workflows - automate device management
entry.content:
1036 [bug] :bug: There is a bug where a new workflow is not executed until you switch the Trigger type

Hey y'all ğŸ‘‹

You, your setup, your use cases... are different from mine and everyone's else's. I also don't like implementing really narrow features, that help only a handful of users.

So I thought, well, how about I let YOU to change the application behavior?

Here come ğŸ”€ Workflow Automations ğŸ¥³

So, what can you do? You can change any Device field, or delete the Device itself, if any number of custom conditions are fulfilled. For example, you can UN-archive a device if it's detected online. Or group devices with a specific name or vendor into a group. Or assign devices to a location depending on the IP they get...

These are only examples, but I think you get the idea. Happy tinkering and automating! Share your workflows in Discord or GitHub Discussions.

There are also some smaller improvements, so check them out below â¬

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • Better Notification processing docs ğŸ†•
  • Workflows Overview ğŸ†•

âš™Settings

  • A new LUCIRPC_only_reachable setting on the LUCIRPC to be able to import reachable or unreachable devices from OpenWRT #1010 ğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • ICMP failed if the setting LOG_LEVEL was set to verbose or higher #1025 âœ¨
  • MQTT didn't send updates for all fields, only some #1019 âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • Cleanup of the Network topology view âœ¨

ğŸ’ Core app updates

Internal changes affecting the whole app and usually significant to developers ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’»

  • LOADED_PLUGINS docker environment variable didn't work with the default app.conf #1023 âœ¨
  • Custom values of the devParentNode and devParentPort field were overwritten by plugins #1021 âœ¨

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • Changing absolute path URL to relative path URL in devices.php by @cvc90 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1022
  • Changing absolute path URL to relative path URL in userNotifications.php by @cvc90 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1024
  • Next release - Workflow work by @jokob-sk in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1029

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v25.3.1...v25.4.1

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v25.4.14 - Styling, Workflows and other fixes
entry.content:
Hi,

This is a small release to fix some of the outstanding styling issues and a workflow issue, where a newly created workflow won't trigger unless the trigger type is changed.

Best, Jokob

What's Changed

  • Update manager.py by @Tlaloc-Es in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1041
  • Update DOCKER_COMPOSE.md by @LeoRX in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1045

New Contributors

  • @Tlaloc-Es made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1041
  • @LeoRX made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1045

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v25.4.1...v25.4.14

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v25.5.24 - MQTT, UI improvements, multiple notification emails
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

This update includes brings small enhancements across the board:

  • MQTT plugin now supports an "Alert Down" flag to better track device status
  • SMTP plugin supports multiple recipient emails
  • New localized date/time UI and improved tooltips
  • In-app notifications auto-cleanup with MAINT_NOTI_LENGTH
  • Plus: better error reporting in WEBMON, more reliable long emails, and fixes to plugin-watching alerts

Thanks to @jangrewe for the SMTP fix! See details below.

âš™Settings

  • A new MAINT_NOTI_LENGTH setting to auto-delete in-app notifications #1052 ğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • MQTT additional Alert Down attribute so you can check and filter down devices #1057 âœ¨
  • WEBMON more statuses for different errors (SSL, timeout) âœ¨
  • SMTP now supports multiple email addresses #1061 âœ¨

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • Dates are localized in most places based on the TIMEZONE setting #1044 ğŸ†•
  • Fixed tooltips in presence view hover #1066 âœ¨

ğŸ’ Core app updates

  • Watched_Value1-4 changes didn't trigger notifications if you were watching plugin changes #1053 âœ¨
  • Some SMTP servers were not handling 1000+ characters per line which could result in broken links in emails #1049 âœ¨ - thanks to @jangrewe ğŸ™

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • properly indent HTML tables in report emails to fix broken links by @jangrewe in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1058
  • Fix minor typo "longet" by @KihtrakRaknas in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1068

New Contributors

  • @jangrewe made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1058
  • @KihtrakRaknas made their first contribution in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1068

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v25.4.14...v25.5.24

entry.title: New release for NetAlertX: v25.6.7 - Legacy upgrade removal and Fully Qualified Domain Names ğŸ†
entry.content:
Hi everyone! ğŸ‘‹

To simplify code maintenance (the database.py file has been reduced from 1000 to 500 lines), Iâ€™ve removed legacy migration support from PiAlert and dropped support for older database upgrade paths.

Thereâ€™s no impact if you're upgrading from version v25.5.24 to this release. However, if you're on an older version, please upgrade to v25.5.24 first by pulling the previous image:

ghcr.io/jokob-sk/netalertx:25.5.24

Then restart the application.

Upgrading from PiAlert is still supported â€” just ensure you first run the v25.5.24 version before upgrading to the latest release.

New in this version:

  • âœ… Auto-updated FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) collection
  • ğŸ” New DIGSCAN plugin to collect FQDN via active scans
  • ğŸ› ï¸ Added init check under the Maintenance section to help debug startup issues

Big thanks to @johnwang16 for the reverse proxy fixes, and to everyone who submitted translations so quickly â€” @GitSpoon, @mapi68, @Maksim2005UA, @yunyi35 ğŸ™

Hope you find the new features useful! As always, happy to hear your feedback here or on Discord.

Let me know if you'd like a shorter or more technical version too!

ğŸ’” Breaking changes

Sometimes I have to introduce breaking changes

  • Due to code refactoring in order to upgrade to this version you have to run a previous version of the application (e.g. run ghcr.io/jokob-sk/netalertx:25.5.24 before upgrading to this version). To simplify maintenance migration from PiAlert has been removed and previous PiAlert installations will have to run the ghcr.io/jokob-sk/netalertx:25.5.24 image for an automated migration. See the migration docs for details.

ğŸ“šDocs updates

  • Rewritten quick start guide âœ¨

âš™Settings

  • A new REFRESH_FQDN setting to auto-update the Device Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) #1065 ğŸ†•

ğŸ”ŒPlugins

  • DIGSCAN new Dig plugin from code refactoring ğŸ†•

ğŸ–¼ UI

  • New Initialization check under Maintenance ğŸ†•
  • devMac added to workflow fields for more automation options ğŸ†•

Other Info

| ğŸ†• - New features | âœ¨ - Fixes & Improvements | âš  - Possibly breaking changes | ğŸ§ª - Experimental/work in progress | |--------------------|------------------------------|--------------------------------|--------------------------------|

What's Changed

  • use relative paths for reverse proxy by @johnwang16 in https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/pull/1071

Full Changelog: https://github.com/jokob-sk/NetAlertX/compare/v25.5.24...v25.6.7
